name: Services, Servicelayer, API
title: Services, Servicelayer, API
body:
Overview

This article provides comprehensive information on activating and managing services, service layer, and API for customers using the EFS platform. It covers the process of setting up services, creating users and teams, managing access rights, and troubleshooting common issues.

Customer-facing article: How-to: Service Layer.

Information

This guide focuses on the steps required to activate services for customers, manage service layer access, and handle API-related tasks. 

  • Activate Services for a Customer
  • Manuals
  • Customer Test Service Layer on TRIAL Installation
  • Text Template for Customers
  • Help for Support Requests

Activate Services for a Customer

To activate services for a customer, certain requirements must be met and specific steps need to be followed:

Requirements

  • The customer has a dedicated installation
  • Sales has sold and ordered this via https://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/order_survey/

Support Steps

Technical Support needs to activate webservices by following these steps:

  1. Go to Options -> Platform cockpit -> root only:: System configuration
  2. Change "has_webservices" to "true"
  3. Change "modules" and add "custom"
  4. Create a new team (e.g., "servicelayer")
  5. Create a new user If you don't know a specific person that will use the service layer, create a dummy user:
    1. Account name "servicelayer" with email address "servicelayer@3uu.eu" (the email address can be changed later on so that the user can receive password mails)
    2. Team: servicelayer
    3. Primary Team: servicelayer
  6. Navigate to Options > Services > Service configuration > Internal:: Tokens and generate a new token for the service layer user. Check ticket #4450666 for reference.

  7. If you already know which service layer methods will be used, activate them for the service layer team and grant the team needed ACL rights:

    1. Navigate to Options > Services > Service configuration > Services > activate desired services and grant access rights

    2. Navigate to System > Users > Teams > edit service layer team > Change rights of this team (only area_www required ?)

  8. Inform the client or contact person:
    • Send access data for service layer user
    • Send password via https://onetimesecret.com/

Note: The customer can check available services by calling the WSDL with the token: https://customers_domain/service/?handler=soap&wsdl=1&token=[TOKEN]

Customer Test Service Layer on TRIAL Installation (NEED TO CONFIRM WITH TIVIAN FURTHER)

First Level Support to do:

  1. Create a new user: servicelayer_OrganizationXY
  2. Add User in Test-Team of the customer
  3. Create Token and assign user (from step 1)

After testing period is finished:

  • Delete Token
  • Delete User 'servicelayer_ORGANIZATION'

Important: For installations with multiple organizations, some steps may not be applicable.

Text Template for Customers

English Template

All service methods "System >> Options >> Service-Layer" are inactive by default. To use a service, please follow these steps:

  1. To activate a service, click on "No" in column "Activated"
  2. Grant the team (i.e., "servicelayer") access to a service by editing the "Rights" in column "Actions"
  3. Grant the team the needed ACL rights
  4. Grant the team the needed object rights

German Template

Alle Methoden der Service-Layer "System >> Optionen >> Service-Schicht" sind standardmäßig inaktiv. Um eine Service-Layer-Methode zu verwenden, folgen Sie bitte diesen Schritten:

  1. Um eine Service-Layer-Methode zu aktivieren, klicken Sie auf "Nein" in der Spalte "Aktiviert"
  2. Erteilen Sie dem Team Zugriff auf die Methoden der Service-Layer
  3. Gewähren Sie dem Team die benötigten ACL-Rechte
  4. Erteilen Sie dem Team die benötigten Objektrechte

Help for Support Requests

When handling web service requests, always perform the following checks before forwarding cases to Technical Support:

  1. Is the token valid (expiry date)?

    1. Check if the “Access date” of the used token is still in the future → System > Options > Service-Layer > qb only:: Tokens

  2. Is the service '[used service]' active?

    1. Check if service is active → System > Options > Service-Layer

  3. Does the team in which the user to whom the used token is assigned have access to the web service? Under System > Options > Services >> Actions (rights/paragraph icon) Check:

    1. Which user/token accesses the used service → System > Options > Service-Layer > Access log

    2. If any of the teams of the user the token is assigned to has object rights for the service → System > Options > Service-Layer > ‘[used service]’ Actions column > Rights

    3. If the used service is limited by an IP range and if the call is within this range → Compare IP in System > Options >> Service-Layer > Access log with System > Options > Service-Layer > ‘[used service]’ column “IP range”

  4. Does the team in which the user to whom the used token is assigned have the appropriate ACL rights that are required for the functionality that is to be accessed via web service?

    1. Check if any of the teams of the user the token is assigned to has the needed ACL rights → System > Users > Teams” “Detail view > Change rights of team

  5. Does any of the teams of the account the used token is assigned to have access to the object (i. e. a project)?

    1. Check if the any of the teams of the user the token is assigned to has object rights → Projects > Survey menu > Change rights

FAQ

How can I check which services I have access to?

You can easily check your accessible services by calling the WSDL with your token using this URL format: https://customers_domain/service/?handler=soap&wsdl=1&token=[TOKEN]

What should I do if a service is not working as expected?

First, verify that all the steps in the "Help for Support Requests" section have been followed. If the issue persists, it may be necessary to open a support ticket for further investigation.

Can multiple teams have access to the same service?

Yes, multiple teams can have access to the same service. You'll need to grant the necessary rights and permissions to each team that requires access.
